availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Jacob Snyder (Clark County, Ohio, lawyer and mayor of Springfield)

body.p: Springfield, Clark County, Ohio, attorney and mayor of Springfield. Somerset County, Pennsylvania, native. Son of John L. Snyder and Isabella S. Snyder. Married to Josephine Cramer Snyder in Champaign County, Ohio, on September 17, 1862. Father of Harry Snyder. Resident of Clark County, Ohio, in 1850. Attorney in Clark County in 1860. Attorney in Clark County in 1863. Mayor of Springfield, Clark County, Ohio, from 1863 to 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Ohio, Clark County, Springfield, p. 202B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Ohio, Clark County, Springfield, p. 371.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Ohio, Clark County, Springfield, p. 351A.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Clark County, OH, June 1863, p. 527.
Ohio Marriage Records, 1774-1993, Champaign County Marriages, Film 000317334, p. 99.
William Mahlon Rockel, 20th Century History of Springfield, and Clark County, Ohio, and Representative Citizens (Chicago: Biographical Publishing Co., 1908) pp. 376, 816-7.
"John Jacob Snyder (1833-1898)," Find A Grave, Memorial 34829988, accessed January 19, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/34829988.
